auth.fill: Please fill out the fields below

analysisBoardPage.loginPrompt: You must be logged in to access board analysis
analysisBoardPage.pgnTooltip: Portable Game Notation (PGN) is a standard plain text format for recording chess games (both the moves and related data), which can be read by humans and is also supported by most chess software.
analysisBoardPage.pgnPrompt: Make a move or import a game to start analysis
analysisBoardPage.fenTooltip: Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) is the standard notation to describe positions of a chess game. The notation system was created by  Steven J. Edwards, a computer programmer. FEN differs from PGN because it denotes only a single position instead of the moves that lead to it.
